name: Residenza Paolo VI

reviews.title: the best
reviews.text: Wonderful location, delightful service. Have zero complaints.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel for it's amazing location just yards from St. Peter's square, helpful and polite staff, large beds (which is hard to find in Rome!), and absolutely beautiful view of St. Peter's dome from the hotel's roof deck. The afternoon we arrived in Rome, (after our flight was delayed from NYC 3 hours) would have been our only opportunity to see the Vatican museum including the Sistine Chapel; and had it not been for the hotel's prime location there is no way we would have made it in. As for distances to attractions....St. Peters Square is literally across the street; it's about a 5 minute walk to the Vatican Museum entrance (minus time waiting on the long line); and less than 15 min walk to Castel St. Angelo. We stayed on this side of the city 1 night before a cruise, and on the other side of the city closer to the Colusseun for 1 night after our cruise. Best experience ever!
reviews.title: You can't get any closer!

likes.liked: — Location, staff, large beds, breakfast included, roofdeck view

reviews.text: Perfect location across the street from the Vatican. The view from the terrace is phenomenal. The breakfast was very elegant. (My family was very excited about the fact that they had eggs and bacon.)
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and quite roomy. Please note: You get what you pay for. I had a party of 6 that we split into 2 triple rooms.
reviews.title: Peter, I can see your house from here

likes.disliked: — The room was small but it wasn't a problem to us at all

reviews.title: Great little place - but read on...

reviews.text: If you are planning to visit the Vatican museums, Sistine Chapel and/or St. Peter's, you absolutely cannot stay any closer. The Paolo VI is literally across the street from the exit of Piazza San Pietro (St. Peter's Square). When we finished our exhausting and hot, but very worthwhile tour of the Vatican museums and Sistine Chapel, we literally walked out the exit, crossed the street and were in our room with our feet up within 5 minutes.
reviews.title: Great location, odd hotel
Exceptional!
reviews.text: However, this is a very expensive hotel with few amenities. We paid EUR340 for one night in a Deluxe room, including buffet breakfast and tax. (By the way, a Deluxe room is not the cheapest room. I believe the cheapest room was around EUR300.)

Our room was totally charmless. It reminded me of a room in a well-maintained retirement home. The floor was light-colored marble, with three inexpensive "Oriental" throw rugs scattered about. The room's cherry furnishings were very plain -- obviously new but not particularly high-end.
reviews.title: Magnificent

reviews.text: A solo traveller (although meeting friends in Rome), this was a superb central spot; opposite St Peters Square with fantastic views of the dome at night.
reviews.title: Comfortable, central & welcoming
Very pleased
reviews.text: Rooms were small (but I was a single) and a little noisy, but nothing that a pair of earplugs couldn't put right.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean and well equipped with a lovely little "daily prayer" posted through your door each morning as the hotel is owned by Vatican Accommodations it is mainly (but by no means exclusively) frequented by priests and their families.
reviews.title: Loved the roof-top terrace view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely choice at breakfast time and a cracking roof top terrace.
reviews.title: racism at Paolo VI
Nice, Elegant Hotel with a great location

likes.disliked: — there was nothing I didn't like

reviews.text: I just returned from a stay at the Residenza Paolo VI, and will never stay anywhere else in Rome. I gather from some of the reviews and photos that I was fortunate to have a deluxe room, which was comfortable, beautiful, quiet, and spotless. It had a marble floor, and a couple of lovely oriental rugs; damask drapes; and simple, but attractive, furniture. There were casement windows -- a delightful contrast to the sealed-in windows in typical modern hotels. I cannot speak for the other rooms in the hotel, but my experience was delightful. The front desk staff was incredibly helpful and charming. I felt safe (the front door is locked in the evening), and the location -- just off one side of Piazza San Pietro -- was incredible. We strolled right from breakfast over to the papal audience in front of St. Peter's. The breakfast room is particularly beautiful, and the buffet breakfast was ample and delicious. Service in the breakfast room was pleasant, but on the relaxed side. Not a big problem, as the more impatient among us could just walk a few feet and pour ourselves a cup of coffee. The view from the terrace is matchless. There are a lot of good restaurants in the area, and a taxi stand right across the square. I recommend the hotel very, very highly, and I am a frequent business traveller with high standards.
reviews.title: The only place I will stay in Rome from now on
Not worth the Money
reviews.text: Do not be taken in by the great marketing for this hotel, pity it doesnt live up to it.
Overpriced, rooms tiny, air conditioning poor, lift archaic, terrace tiny, appears on photos much better than it actually is.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed with my "cell"

reviews.text: I suggest you look elsewhere unless you absolutely must be about 500yds from St Peters Square.
reviews.title: TINY tiny teeny-tiny rooms - 2 star hotel

description: The Residenza Paolo VI, established in the premises of an Augustinian Monastery, was inaugurated at the beginning of the Holy Year 2000. The genius loci and the charm of tradition are still alive in its ancient walls to make this property your “private” heaven in Rome, far away from chaos, yet situated in the pulsing heart of the Eternal City. Rome has many hotels, but only one of them stands directly on St. Peter’s Square (Vatican): Residenza Paolo VI, the ideal place for those wishing to stay in the heart of the Christendom,St. Peter’s Basilica
